column1: Tío Vernon volvió a sentarse, resoplando como un rinoceronte al que le faltara el aire y vigilando estrechamente a Harry por el rabillo de sus ojos pequeños y penetrantes.
column2: Uncle Vernon sat back down, snorting/puffing/panting like a rhinoceros short of breath and watching Harry closely out of the corner of his small, piercing eyes.

column1: Castigo propuesto: ... Secándose la nariz, Filch miró con desagrado a Harry, entornando los ojos.
column2: Proposed punishment: ... Wiping (/drying off/mopping up) his nose, Filch glared at Harry, narrowing his eyes.

column1: Desde luego, no se parecía a papá Noel: era pequeño y de piel curtida, con una cabeza grande y huesuda, parecida a una patata.
column2: He certainly didn't look like Father Christmas: he was small and leathery-skinned, with a big, bony, potato-like head.

column1: Harry, en cambio, era pequeño y flacucho.
column2: Harry, on the other hand, was small and skinny.
